column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=RM : Yeah well , that ’s sort of my running thing .
#Text=That was sort of a response to people who were really concerned about blame and always have disclaimers that say " by the way , we do n’t endorse this " .
#Text=I ’m like , do you mean that ?
#Text=Do you have to say that ?
#Text=Can you say that ?
#Text=If you say " I do endorse this " does this change things ?
#Text=What if I say I endorse it if it 's really cool .
#Text=And I do n’t know .
#Text=When I do something it 's my responsibility ; I ’m deciding whether to take that risk and if someone gets an idea from me and goes and does something dangerous that ’s up to them .
#Text=I did n’t say well do dangerous things no matter what , so ...
#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=The man in the black hat seems to at least many readers to be one of your favorite characters .
#Text=Can you talk about him a bit ?
#Text=R. Well , I decided early on that I sometimes wanted to be an asshole and sometimes I wanted to be sappy and romantic .
#Text=And unlike the nerdiness and the romance , the asshole seemed harder to reconcile in one character and make that believable .
#Text=I started putting the man in the hat , when I just wanted to say the most absurd thing .
#Text=A lot of the time , I ’m in a real life situation and I think what ’s the most hurtful thing , what ’s the worst way this can go , and have someone do that gleefully .
#Text=That ’s just a recipe for comedy right there .

#Text=Then I have the guy in the hat so I ’d put all that on him and then say “ but that ’s not the main guy , he ’s much nicer than that ” and , and I took that , the black hat symbolizes that for me because Aram from the now ended webcomic Men in Hats also wore a hat .
#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=So it ’s not Black-hat in the hacker sense ?
#Text=R. No , it ’s actually a black hat because there are only so many articles of clothing you can draw on a stick figure .
#Text=I realized that I associated a black hat with gleeful asshole and that was a character I liked a lot of a since ended strip .
#Text=Specific comics
#Text=( (
#Text=WN
#Text=) )
#Text=Regarding Comic 304 , " Nightime Stories " - Speaker for the Dead or Ender 's Game ?
#Text=R. Speaker for the Dead is a much more grown up book .
#Text=I felt much less of a connection to growing up so I would say Ender ’s Game .
#Text=I ’ve read Speaker .
#Text=I appreciate it some extent .
#Text=I did n’t feel as personal as Ender ’s game .
#Text=And I did n’t respond to it the same way .
#Text=I reread Ender ’s Game every half a year or so for quite a while .
#Text=Probably 12 or 15 times now where it just was such an engaging story and such an engaging set of characters .
#Text=I went back to it over and over .
#Text=And that ’s something I have n’t done with any of the other books in that section of the Ender ’s series .
